meanings.definition: To eat the flesh of one's own kind.
meanings.sent1: The starving lion had to cannibalize its own cub for survival.
meanings.sent2: In the horror movie, the zombie cannibalized its fellow undead creatures.
meanings.sent3: The vampire jokingly said, 'I can't cannibalize my neighbor; they're too tough!'
meanings.sent4: The competitive eater seemed to cannibalize the hotdog-eating contest, finishing all the food in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The tribe's ritual involved cannibalizing the strongest warrior to absorb their bravery.

meanings.definition: To use parts of a machine or product to repair or build another.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to cannibalize an old car to fix the vintage vehicle.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to cannibalize old computers to create new prototypes.
meanings.sent3: The robot joked, 'I will cannibalize my spare parts if I keep bumping into walls!'
meanings.sent4: The artist's sculpture seemed to cannibalize various materials, creating a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The spacecraft had to cannibalize its damaged engine to power the emergency thrusters.
